summary: Completed comprehensive testing of LiquiFlow on-chain analytics application. Backend APIs are fully functional (100% success rate), but critical frontend JavaScript runtime errors prevent full UI testing and navigation.

critical_bugs.issue: Maximum call stack size exceeded - RangeError in Sankey implementation
critical_bugs.impact: Prevents Flow Graph page from loading and causes navigation failures
critical_bugs.error_details: RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded at Math.max in updateDepthOfTargets function

critical_bugs.issue: JavaScript runtime errors prevent page navigation after initial load
critical_bugs.impact: Users cannot navigate between pages (Entities, Transactions, Pools, Alerts)

integration_issues.issue: Runtime errors prevent testing of page-to-page navigation and filter functionality

passed_tests: Dashboard Stats API (Volume 24h: $1.75B, Transactions: 482K, Active Entities: 89K)
Networks API (4 networks: Ethereum, BNB Chain, Polygon, Arbitrum)
Entities API with pagination and filters (network, entity_type)
Entity Detail API with counterparties and balances
Transactions API with filters (network, tx_type, value ranges)
Transaction Detail API with internal transactions
Pools API with liquidity and protocol filters
Pool Detail API with LP holders and recent events
Alerts API with severity and type filters
Flow Graph API (nodes and links generation)
Price History API (ETH 7d data with 168 data points)
All filter parameters (network, entity_type, tx_type, severity)
Dashboard page initial load with stats cards
Layout component with sidebar and header structure
Header components (search input, network selector, connect wallet button)
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix JavaScript runtime errors in frontend. The Sankey chart component in Flow Graph is causing 'Maximum call stack size exceeded' errors that prevent navigation and full UI testing. Need to debug the Recharts Sankey implementation or replace with alternative visualization. All backend APIs are working perfectly.

success_percentage.frontend: 30% (basic load works, but navigation and core features fail due to JS errors)
